text: Today, Senate Republicans made it crystal clear that rushing a Supreme Court nomination is more important than helping the American people who are suffering from a deadly pandemic and a devastating economic crisis.

Senate Republicans haven’t lifted a finger in 150 days to consider the House’s COVID-19 relief bill—but they’re determined to rush through a SCOTUS confirmation. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EkKfTxHXgAMW8eT.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1315769226427236356/vid/320x320/6uIKQXtA-Ajn_jHA.mp4?tag=13

The hearings this week should have been postponed. Instead, Chairman Graham is bringing together more than 50 people in a room while our country faces a deadly airborne virus—without requiring testing.

Myka was diagnosed with a congenital heart defect days after birth. Every year she sees specialists and undergoes MRIs that total tens of thousands of dollars.

If Republicans succeed in dismantling the ACA, insurance companies could deny her coverage because it's too expensive. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EkKYHycXkAIys8X.jpg

A majority of Americans want whomever wins the election to fill this seat. Yet this illegitimate committee process is underway just 22 days before the end of the election—when more than 9 million Americans have already cast their ballots. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EkKBLfSWkAEZB6-.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1315749338719584256/vid/320x320/zaId_B3SrRlGKf7Y.mp4?tag=13

I just shared Myka’s incredible story in my opening statement. Striking down the Affordable Care Act would do unimaginable harm to her and so many others. Yet this Supreme Court nominee was chosen to help ensure that happens. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EkJhHKMXYAAi8_b.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1315719634415497220/vid/320x320/bG16hX8fQ3Alri1C.mp4?tag=13

Because Chairman Graham has recklessly chosen to bring more than 50 people inside a room in the midst of a deadly airborne virus, I’ll be delivering my opening statement from my Senate office.

Tune in here. https://www.pscp.tv/w/clMwmzFWR2p2cUFEeURPS098MWRSS1pabERPWk1LQpRjosSfWH2EpwBTEb8oOK2bGC5sGnEDcDfHPIFVD30I

November 10. That's when the United States Supreme Court is set to hear a case to strike down the Affordable Care Act.

Senate Republicans are fast tracking this nominee today in order to ensure that happens.

To everyone who is barely hanging onto their homes, who has lost a loved one to COVID-19, who has no way to pay the bills: know that instead of voting to provide relief you desperately need, Senate Republicans today are choosing to hold a hearing to confirm a judge.

Voting is underway in at least 40 states. Let the people decide. #HonorHerWish http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1315849241806372864/pu/img/2OkTNx4kWIl9bKjL.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1315849241806372864/pu/vid/476x270/YCucVfEGSrsvm7b_.mp4?tag=10

RT @CAPAction “[Trump] promised explicitly that he would only nominate judges that would ‘do the right thing’ and eliminate the Affordable Care Act.” —@CoryBooker

A vote to confirm Amy Coney Barrett is a vote to take away health care from millions of Americans. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1315697076861169665/pu/img/GwZWIb4j_ZCXaV4g.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1315697076861169665/pu/vid/480x270/auknOyI2q-bbNRSB.mp4?tag=10

The Affordable Care Act allowed Merritt to get health insurance through his job shortly after he was diagnosed with Type 2 Diabetes. If the ACA is struck down, he—and millions of Americans—may not be able to afford critical medicines. #WhatsAtStake http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EkJKho1XkAAWl7r.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1315676144927154176/vid/320x320/oijklmORV8rk1JWy.mp4?tag=13

Nothing about this is normal. Nothing about this is right. Nothing about this is just. This election is ongoing. The American people should decide who gets to nominate our country’s next Supreme Court Justice. 

I will not be voting to confirm Judge Barrett’s nomination.

It’s very simple. @SenateGOP know the American people don’t want this, but they don’t care. Because they only have a small window of opportunity to cheat the system & betray what Americans want—so they’re desperately rushing to finish this process before Americans finish voting.

In the middle of a deadly pandemic, in the middle of an ongoing election, Senate Republicans have found a nominee in Judge Barrett who they know will do what they couldn’t do—subvert the will of the American people & overturn the ACA, overturn Roe v. Wade. That’s #WhatsAtStake.
The American people should know: Republicans in Washington have been trying to take away your health coverage for over 10 years. Again and again they’ve tried, and again and again, they’ve failed.
Now the Trump Administration is trying to take away health care from millions of Americans in the courts. That is why we are here today. That’s #WhatsAtStake.

Senate Republicans don’t want to wait and hear from Americans in this election because they already know the American people don’t want this. When it comes to the ACA, they know because they’ve tried—in the Senate, in the House, between the two, over 70 failed attempts.

Senate Republicans know that the majority of Americans don’t want Roe v. Wade to be overturned—that the majority of Americans don’t want to see abortion criminalized. But that’s why we’re here today. Because Senate Republicans know the American people don’t want this.

Senate Republicans know that the American people don’t want the Affordable Care Act to be overturned. They know that even the majority of Republicans support provisions of the ACA like protecting people with pre-existing conditions.

We’re just 22 days away from Election Day—in the middle of an ongoing election, when millions of people have already started voting—@SenateGOP are afraid of the truth: that they might not be able to get away with their Supreme Court nominee after the American people have spoken.

When Michelle unexpectedly lost her husband, she relied on the ACA to get affordable coverage for her and her daughter. Her pre-existing conditions have her worried about getting insurance if the ACA is struck down. #WhatsAtStake http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1315676211260141568/img/QzMW2wmP_ctuaSG-.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1315676211260141568/vid/320x320/6JkbjaBGuu7Mvlon.mp4?tag=13

Getting ready to speak in the @SenJudiciary hearing about #WhatsAtStake as Senate Republicans ram through their illegitimate Supreme Court nominee. Health care for millions. Roe v. Wade. So much is on the line—@SenateDems are fighting for Americans. Watch: https://twitter.com/i/events/1314608482788630528

Let’s be clear: nothing about today’s hearing is normal. It’s not normal that @SenateGOP are rushing through a confirmation hearing, violating their own words all to ensure that millions of Americans will lose their health care in the middle of a pandemic.

At least two members of @SenJudiciary have recently been diagnosed with COVID-19—and we have no idea what kind of threat they or others pose to those around them today because they refuse to agree to mandatory testing.

Today we are holding a hearing on a Supreme Court nominee, rushing through an illegitimate process, when we’re supposed to be working to protect the health and safety of Americans, and we can’t even do it in our own workplace—
In New Jersey, 595,000 people would lose their coverage without the Affordable Care Act—that’s #WhatsAtStake right now as Senate Republicans rush through their illegitimate Supreme Court nominee.

#WhatsAtStake right now:
—Health care for 130 million Americans with pre-existing conditions
—20 million people losing their access to potentially life-saving care in the middle of a pandemic that has killed over 214,000 Americans

Today was a very good day. Democrats had no meaningful, substantive criticisms of Judge Barrett at @senjudiciary. That’s because they know her qualifications are impeccable. That says a lot. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1315821482405134336/img/3zAy4UEqetVUjTQS.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1315821482405134336/vid/480x270/9aOl_TF3kSdWGdgg.mp4?tag=13

That is not the Court’s job. The Court’s job is to decide cases according to the law and to leave policymaking to the elected legislature. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1315749843415990273/img/d0ISNyfMtAmr8Tcs.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1315749843415990273/vid/480x270/xZJx2RY75AeqyVne.mp4?tag=13

When I was beginning my career, Ruth Bader Ginsburg sat in this seat.

She said, “what has become of me could only happen in America.”

I have been nominated to fill Justice Ginsburg's seat, 

but no one will EVER take her place. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EkJt3rIXgAIYnaY.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1315734364848828418/vid/320x320/k4gLJpk3ETV-TPHY.mp4?tag=13

Democrats and Republicans have fundamentally different visions of the Supreme Court.

Democrat Senators view the court as a policymaking body—A body that will decree outcomes to the American people.

That vision of the court is found *nowhere* in the Constitution. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EkI4aFLWAAI15Dz.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1315674236606873603/vid/320x320/0X5TKYxWYx1Tj2a6.mp4?tag=13

Amy Coney Barrett brings impeccable credentials, a judicial temperament, and a faithfulness to the law. I look forward to asking Judge Barrett questions this week at @senjudiciary and to confirming her to the #SCOTUS in the weeks ahead. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1315749843415990273/img/d0ISNyfMtAmr8Tcs.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1315749843415990273/vid/480x270/xZJx2RY75AeqyVne.mp4?tag=13

2020 is not the 1st time a #SCOTUS vacancy has been filled in an election year:
-29 times there has been a vacancy in an election year & presidents made nominations 29 times
-19 times the White House and Senate were controlled by the same party
-17 times the nominee was confirmed http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1315725984050618371/img/-3FW0XuC4yDdyy5y.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1315725984050618371/vid/480x270/PLznJlqjSynWhole.mp4?tag=13

Democrats view the Supreme Court as a super legislature, as a policymaking body that will decree outcomes to the American people.

That vision of the Supreme Court is found nowhere in the U.S. Constitution.

If today’s Supreme Court hearings to steal a Supreme Court seat make you furious, get in the fight and make your voice heard. The power isn’t just in the Senate Judiciary Committee hearing room right now – the power is with you.

This absurd hearing is happening today because Amy Coney Barrett is the last hope for a desperate, undemocratically overrepresented party trying to cling to power just a little longer, & impose the agenda of billionaires, giant corporations, & far-right extremists on our country.

Most Americans don’t want the Supreme Court to take away abortion rights. Most Americans don’t want the Supreme Court to rip away health care from millions of people. And most Americans believe that the next President should be filling this Supreme Court seat.

Senate Republicans know that Amy Coney Barrett will gut health care. That’s why they’re racing the clock to get her on the bench before the Supreme Court hears the case on November 10th that could deal the death blow to the Affordable Care Act. https://www.marketwatch.com/story/the-supreme-courts-obamacare-case-was-high-stakes-before-ruth-bader-ginsburgs-death-heres-why-its-even-more-important-now-2020-09-22

That’s why they’re rushing this hearing without forcing Barrett to disclose her full anti-choice background, like her talks and support of anti-abortion groups. https://www.cnn.com/2020/10/09/politics/kfile-amy-coney-barrett-roe-v-wade-talks/index.html

Today's sham hearing – on a holiday, 22 days from Election Day, during a COVID-19 outbreak in the Judiciary Committee with a likely-exposed Chairman who won't get tested – shows just how far the GOP will go to steal another Supreme Court seat & hand our courts over to extremists.
